intro: Hydrolea paraguayensis f. grandifolia, commonly known as the Paraguay hydrolea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its roots are valued in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments, making it a popular choice for rainforest gardens.
